item.title: Paper Folding
item.description: In april 2020 I created this demo / proof of concept of a game whose mechanics is based on folding of the sheet of paper. Each side of the paper represents completely different environments. By folding the paper those environments could be combined as a result letting the main character reach the goal (this part is not implemented in this demo).

item.title: How I broke Incremental GC in Unity
item.description: Once upon a time, before releasing Summer Catchers on Steam, I was trying to make our game as smooth as possible. Since we are using object pooling our game almost does not have memory allocations after a new scene is loaded and thus it does not require to use GC.

item.title: How I made logos crisper, while also minimizing a memory footprint and a build size
item.description: Minimizing the build size of your game is always a plus: it saves your disk space, it saves your time to upload and your players’ time to download, besides some app stores and shops impose size limits. So that’s one of the things which I was doing while porting our game to Nintendo Switch (it’s worth nothing that this optimization and improvement is applicable to other platforms as well).

item.title: StableEnum or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Enums in Unity3d
item.description:
It’s a well-known problem with serialization of enums in Unity3d:

  1. Use enum as a serialized field in your MonoBehaviour or ScriptableObject (or anything serializable).
  2. Fine-tune everything and code your game further casually.
  3. Add some new enumerators in the middle of your enum.
  4. BAM!! You are screwed.

What happened? Nothing fancy: new enumerators of your enum just shifted down the old ones occupying their values, because Unity serializes enums as ints.
Solution is easy: serialize enums as strings. And StableEnum will help you with this.

item.title: Nested canvas bug
item.description:
Weird bug related to UI.Canvas was accidentally found by me while I was developing new menu for our upcoming game SummerCatchers. Btw, follow us ;)
